1.content:
Right, let's start this off!

Choice 1: Continue from an existing storyline.
As I said before, the story before it simply vanished, so as such, there are some plot lines left unresolved. Herein, we will continue them, and inject new ideas into them if possible.

The rest of the choices are for you all to start a story based on a Pokemon of your choice. Other Pokemon, even from other regions, may be added along the way without any restriction, but try to keep the focus onto the chosen Pokemon in question!
1.title: Starting Point

11.content:
This section is for reviving previously existent storylines.

If you want to add anything to this section, please let me know beforehand, or they will be deleted.
11.title: Continue from an existing storyline.

choices: Floatzel picks her up onto his belly, and makes a beeline for Slateport.
Floatzel picks up the Miltank, and devours her!
111.content:
(This was the last chapter posted by me before the story vanished into thin air. Sadly I did not save the rest of the storyline before it was gone, but, I'll remember what happened before. Mostly.)

Floatzel decided that he would have to bring the S.S. Moomil to port himself. Good weather or not, according to Lugia a storm that would start the cycle of gluttony once more would come. He had to act fast. Two hours before midnight, he contacted the steward on board once more.

"Psst. You still awake?" Floatzel whispered.

"Yes, Mister Floatzel. What is the matter?"

"Could you...call off the repairs for a couple of hours?"

"We're halfway done. Is there a particular reason?"

"You would not believe me, but there's a storm coming. And it won't be pretty."

"The weather forecast says it's all clear. What are you talking about?"

"Like I said you would not believe me. You all need to be safe on land, and I mean it. No one should be on board me until next morning."

"B-but, we have a schedule to keep!" the steward stood up from his seat, prancing around the control room.

"Please, you can do it. I beg you. Also make sure the people at the pier get to the city, and not linger around there." Floatzel pleaded.

"...Roger." The steward went silent, as he began to make arrangements to have everyone evacuate the ship.


True to his word, the crew members were soon disembarking the S.S. Inflatable in an orderly manner, and dispersing into the city via buses and other vehicles. It took a good thirty minutes before they were all gone, as Floatzel watched them exit the gangplank and in turn boarding other land transport.

The steward was the last to leave, and with a hand to his headset, he spoke to Floatzel once more. "No one is on board you right now. I hope you know what you are doing."

"Yes, I'll see you all in the morning." Floatzel replied, watching the gangplank retract itself back into his structures. "Time to leave..."

"Wait, where are you going?!" Shouted the steward. "Be honest with me."

"I...I'm going to pay the S.S. Moomil a visit. Guide it back safely to port." Floatzel said.

"You can't just make her turn back! There isn't enough reason for her to cancel the test voyage-"

"I'm sorry." mumbled Floatzel, as he spun his tails as fast as he could, propelling him out of the port of Snowpoint City, and in turn cutting off communications with the steward. "I need to go faster if I'm going to make it."


Two hours later...

"This is the way to Slateport, I believe. I hope I'm not lost...Oh wait, there it is!" Floatzel exclaimed, as he spotted the black-white-pink blob ahead of him. The S.s. Moomil had departed, and was quite a distance off the port.

Thankfully, the Miltank was starting out slow, and as such the obese river otter was able to encounter her just making her way out for the test run. He spun his tails once more, closing the distance between him and the Milk Cow Pokemon.

"Geez, I don't know what were they thinking, making me try and complete this run without the aid of an engine." The Miltank fumed, as she continously spun her flabby tail and kicked her massive rear legs, to push herself forward across the sea. "I mean, it's good to be able to move about again, but at this rate it's miserable. It's not like I've got a pair of tails that scales well with my bulk anyways!"

Little did she know that the very thing that she was made to compete with would soon appear right before her eyes, as she saw the S.S. Inflatable appear in the corner of her eye, growing larger as he quickly closed in on her.

"Holy cow, what is that- Wait, it must be that Floatzel! No one else so far has been able to make the mark to be a Pokemon cruise ship, and I just barely made the grade with my weight and water mobility! What is he doing here though? I thought he was being repaired at Snowpoint." The Miltank spoke to herself.

"Huff, huff...Finally, there you are. You must be the S.S. Moomil. I'm Floaty the Floatzel, also known as the S.S. Inflatable." Floatzel paused to catch his breath as he stopped paddling, allowing himself to drift close to Miltank, massively dwarfing her when compared side by side.

"Whoa there, you scared me! What if you crashed right into me, huh?" said the angry Miltank, as she struggled to paddle forwards against the sudden waves when Floatzel swam next to her, but she stopped for a while to let the water be calm again.

"Don't worry about that. Listen, you need to turn back."

"You're not making any sense." the Miltank said, as the crew members aboard her turned to look at the massive orange flab of the S.S. Inflatable block their starboard view. "I've made it out this far, and you want me to swim back now?! Not gonna happen."

"There's no time to argue with her, she won't agree to swim back to port. Not that she'll be fast enough, the storm'll be here before she's even quarter the way there!" Floatzel panicked, a sudden stiff breeze ruffling his fur, as he brought his tails around to wrap about the S.S. Moomil.

"H-hey, what do you think you're doing?! Put me down this instant!" yelled the Miltank as she was ousted from the sea, while flailing her stubby limbs about. The remaining water dripped from her belly fur and massive udders, as she was lifted above the water by the massive river otter before her.
111.title: Continuing on..."Paying a 'Friendly' Visit"

choices: While telling her story, Miltank herself lets Floatzel in on a secret...
Valerie is getting impatient with Floatzel's late return.
1111.content:
Floatzel set the Miltank gently down onto his chins, directly in front of him. He loosened his tails which gripped tightly around the flab and cruise framework of the Cow Pokemon, the combined mass of which now directly weighing down on the river otter's colossal belly, forming a slight depression and pushing the top of his belly flab outwards a little.

"Occupants of the S.S. Moomil, this is the S.S. Inflatable, or more specifically, Floaty himself, speaking." Floatzel spoke through the headset, hoping that the communication systems on board them both were integrated somehow. "I apologise for the rude interruption, but please do not panic. I am just going to escort her back to port, for there is a storm coming. A really big one."

"A-are you kidding, Floatzel? Despite the skies being dark in the night, I barely see any clouds within the vicinity!" Miltank cried out in disbelief. "I don't really know if it's true either, to be honest. But this is no ordinary storm. Better to be safe than sorry!" Floatzel replied, as he brought his tails behind him, and began to spin them up to full speed, making a U-turn and now facing in the direction of Slateport.

"This is outrageous, S.S. Inflatable! We were not informed of this sudden change in plans. But for safety's sake we will do as we are told, and stay put on board the S.S. Moomil." an angry crew member on board her spoke, and the headset went silent.

"Damn it, Floatzel. Ugh, geez- Ah, I suppose I was gettin' a little tired of paddlin' with just my stubby feet and a sorry excuse of a tail, compared to yours, anyways." Miltank sighed, catching her breath. While she was quite cross with him for making her efforts to sail all the way out here naught, she was glad that she got to take a break and let someone else do the heavy lifting. "Hey, don't mention it. I'm sorry about what happened just now, though." Floatzel replied.

"Any case though, you'd better be sure about that damned storm you keep flabberin' about. Otherwise it'll not be just me, but the company after your head." Miltank commented. "Punishment never really crossed my mind, though...what could they possibly do to hurt me at this size anyways?" Floatzel pondered.

Floatzel realised he was paddling a little slower than before he picked up the S.S. Moomil, either it was due to the added weight from his baggage, or that he was quite worn out from going full speed to Slateport.
"Um, if you don't mind, we could just chat for a while as I bring us back to port. You're a little heavy, even for my standards, and I'm still not used to moving with an extra mass doing on my belly."

"Heh, you're one to talk. Shoot."

"So, how does it feel to be the second cruise li- I mean, Pokemon, within the company?"

"Oh, it's surprisingly fufilling! Of course, I'm talking about the tonnes upon tonnes of gastronomic delights I get to devour clean every day." Miltank licked her lips. "Of course, just like on the farm, humans are just trying to fatten me up, but at least it's part of my job description to be big and fat now."

"Ahahaha, likewise, for me too. The stuff they serve up is simply amazing. How did you manage to land this job anyway?"

"Oh, I was just shortlisted as one of the suitable candidates? They have a pretty strict criteria, you know. All thanks to you."

"I-is that so..." Floatzel mused.

"Actually, it's a long story. About two weeks back..."
1111.title: Playing Escort

choices: "Truth is, we're no longer heading back there."
11111.content:
Two weeks ago

"Oh, it's a pleasure being able to finally meet you, President of the cruise company!"

A young lady dressed in a frilly laced outfit stepped into the room, which was decorated quite sparsely with only a table and two chairs on each side, and greeted the middle-aged man before her, who was dressed in formal business wear, complete with a tie, cufflinks, down to his well-polished black suede boots.

"The pleasure is all mine, Miss June. Please, take a seat."

"Thank you!"

The both of them sat down in their respective chairs.

"The Pokemon Cruises so far have been simply, in my opinion, phenomenal! I've been enjoying every single one of them since the first!" June went about excitedly.

"I am glad to hear that. Now, I am a busy man, and my time is money. You did mention wanting to show me something?" the President rested his hands on the table, and asked June.

"I shan't waste your time, President. The view of the port is just right behind you, is it not?"

"How did you- Yes, it is. How did you know about this?" went the President, a tad puzzled.

"Tee-hee. Lucky guess!" June giggled.

The President simply squinted at her.

"Well, I was keeping track of the general direction as I entered your company building, and came to that conclusion." she shrugged. "Anyway enough about that. You should take a look outside your window...now."

"Hmm. Okay." the President smiled, and drew open the blue curtains, revealing a view of the port behind him.

"There's nothing out of the ordin- Wait, hang on a moment. Is that-"

June stood up to confirm if that was what he should be seeing. "Yep! You're looking at one of my lovely Pokemon over there, my adorable Miltank!" she spoke.

Her Miltank was just floating about near one of the docking areas in the port, recently released from a Pokeball by one of her friends who sneaked into the compound. At this moment she weighed more or less six thousand tons, and how June got her that huge is...her well-guarded secret.

"If you're talking about the campaign we were running, to seek out Pokemon cruise worthy, other than Floatzel himself, I have told you before that it's closed." the President dismissed, making reference to one of her letters submitted way past the due date.

"Aww, but the post office was closed quite a few times owing to harsh blizzards, where I live! That was why I could not have gotten it to you sooner...Pretty please, could you spare me a chance? For someone who's a loyal customer?" June winked cutely.

The President sighed. "The other candidates that we have found are being screened at the moment. It would cost extra resources to sign your Miltank up, which I cannot spare."

"You haven't chosen one yet, right? Tell you what, you could just give me a fraction of royalties the campaign mentioned about for selected Pokemon! You'll get another suitable candidate for your fleet, and if Miltank passes your tests it'll cost you less to upkeep right?" June reasoned.

"I...see. Do we have a deal, then?" the President held out his open right hand to June, holding it above the table.

"What? Huh?" went a dazed June, not expecting the President to agree to it so easily. "Yes, sure!" she exclaimed, as she answered his handshake.

"Excellent. My secretary will ready the contract papers. Once you have filled them up and signed them, Your Pokemon will begin testing as soon as possible."

"Yaaay! Thank you so much, President!"

"Note that this is not a confirmation that your Pokemon has been added to the fleet. The technology to build on them is actually rather costly, so we have to be sure that Miltank is suitable for the job." the President spoke, as he proceeded to exit the meeting room, but not before contacting his secretary over the intercom.

-------
Back to present day...

"That's...interesting. So you belong to a trainer." Floatzel realised.

"Yeah, don't you?"

"Nope. Now that I think of it, though, you're not exactly mobile enough to make a good cruise ship. How did you manage to get chosen amongst the rest?"

"Pfft, I knew that question would crop up!" Miltank bellowed. "While it's true that during the selection they found others that were faster than me, some even larger than me- I mean, I thought at that size, I was the largest second only to you, but I got proven wrong! A really fat Wailord beat me! But that's acceptable, since normally Miltank are a lot smaller to begin with." she explained.

Miltank continued, "They tested us based on various factors: things like construction adhesion to our bodies all of us passed, and while I was like the third slowest of the bunch, with or without additional weights, I trumped them all in two parameters; rate of weight gain and inedible digestion."

"Ah, that means you can eat everything, like me, too." Floatzel spoke.

"Despite all that practice June gave me on eating steel cans and broken wood, I still felt a little scared eating things like solid concrete and whole mountains of garbage, but I got over it. Eating everything and anything now feels great to me!" the Miltank said happily.

"So, that's the story on how they picked me. But you look quite trustworthy. I'll let you in on a little secret."

"What is?" Floatzel asked.

"Bring your ear a little closer. I can't exactly budge an inch when out of water." Miltank said disappointedly.

"Right, and you think I'm more mobile. Let's see..." Floatzel, remembering how Valerie manages to reshape herself at will, attempted to soften his chins and neck rolls. He managed to make them a little more mobile, shifting his head gradually and leaning close to the Miltank's face.

"Psst...At the end of the testing, they made me eat everyone else. As a final test." Miltank whispered.

"What?!"

"Shh, not so loud! The contract says that disqualified candidates will be released into the wild, to live their plumped up lives to the fullest, but I think the company was trying to waste not. It worked well for me."

"So, that's why you're so fat."

"And that you're not?" Miltank shot back.

"No, that's not what I meant."

"Fine. Putting it more specifically they made me eat everyone in one sitting. I had to complete it within 24 hours, otherwise they said they would feed me to you." Miltank admitted.

"That's ridiculous! Even if I was to eat you, I would never bring myself to-"

"That's what I thought at the time too, until they announced 'Candidate Miltank, you're the winner, now eat everyone else!'. Without so much of a second thought, all of them went down the hatch, into my big, spacious, plump belly here." she patted it once, causing it to slosh about, giving her a tintillating sensation. "Even that Wailord which I talked about. Came in cocky at ten thousand over tons. So confident he was until he realised he couldn't gain much weight despite eating as much as we all did, and when he was eleven thousand tons by the time they announced me queen of the lot, I was like eighteen and a half. He wasn't so confident any more. That spread of fat Pokemon, all mine to devour, was simply heaven, and exploded my tastebuds! The salty taste of Lapras skin and that craggy shell was surprisingly good, the divine flavour of a blubbery and bloated Dragonite along with his stubby wings was a taste to behold, and that Flygon, a tad dry but a nice change of pace, and oh my, that sweet sweet Wailord! Utterly beating and humiliating him made it taste so much sweeter!~ And I topped it off with a big great *BUUURRRRPPP!*"

"I may have gotten a little too excited there, apologies." the Miltank mumbled, and hushed herself.

"No, it's okay." While Floatzel himself was marvelling a little at this Cow Pokemon's escapades, he himself knew that he was part of...something on a far grander scale.

"Are you not scared of me now?" Miltank questioned.

"Not really. It'll have to be a while before you can even dream of swallowing me whole!" Floatzel laughed.

"That much is true...say, how far are we away from Slateport right now?"
11111.title: Bonding Session

choices: Floatzel manages to go home to Valerie.
The storm kicks up near Valerie's location, and she has to save her children.
111111.content:
"About halfway through."

"It must be tiring on you to sail this far in a day." Miltank said, somewhat concerned.

"Yeah, I could use a drink, other than seawater. The crew is not on board to service me."

"Maybe you could call the crew on board me to serve you?" Miltank suggested.

"May-be. I was thinking..." Floatzel said, eying her impossibly huge and engorged udders.

"...don't even think about it."

"C'mon, just a drink? I've heard great things about Miltank milk, and I've yet to try it for myself!"

"Like what...?"

"Let me quote this from something I saw on television; 'Build healthy bones and teeth!'"

"Uh huh, heard that one so many times." Miltank rolled her eyes.

"...and at least 50% Fat content too." Floatzel ended. "Is that all true?"

"Ugh..."

"I'll find out for myself." Floatzel said, lowering his head to suckle onto one of her udders.

"Hey, Floatzel! You should back off, I didn't say yes!" Miltank shouted, feeling her territory being enroached upon, and a ticklish feeling coursing through her body.

"T-this taste...awesome!" Floatzel thought, as he tasted the river of milk running past his tastebuds. He continued to drink for a full minute, drinking about five swimming pools' worth of the nutritious stuff, before stopping to catch his breath.

"There, you've had enough! Take me back to port already, and stop disturbing me!" Miltank was really peeved now.

Floatzel licked his maw clean of milk, and said, "Miltank, right? You make good milk."

"R-really..." Miltank blushed as she heard that praise. Floatzel murred as he felt the nutrients in the milk add on to the fat on his body, making the ship structures tighter in some spots, but not by much. "50% fat is underestimating it though. At your size it must be more like 90%!" Floatzel joked.

"Gah, you're crazy! Who'd be nuts enough to milk someone like me at this size anyway? It's probably not even healthy for those humans any more." Miltank said.

"Well, it'll be good for me, I'm sure of it." Floatzel smiled.

"Freeloading here, are we Floatzel? And what do I get out of it?" Miltank smirked.

"On my butt, lies some containers full of refuse. Hold on, not some, lots of them. Normally I'd clear them out as soon as I get the chance to, but I've been really busy lately. You can have 'em as long as you let me have a drink every so often?"

"I still don't think it's worth it. How much garbage is there for me to feast on? From what I gather it still sounds like a snack."

It was at that moment that Floatzel himself stopped paddling for a moment, used his tails to grab hold of those containers he spoke of. He grabbed one and set it in front of the Miltank. It was positively overflowing with garbage collected during the S.S. Inflatable's operations.

"Do you have more?" Miltank asked, a feeling a little hungry already. Floatzel then took out all the containers and set them in front of her, stacked neatly on top of the other. Three of them was about her height, and there were dozens of them in between Floatzel's and her head, with Floatzel's own neck rolls partially covering some of them.

Miltank was drooling right now. "I'm not much of a fan of garbage, but...can I have all of that? Pretty please?"

"It's all yours!" Floatzel grinned, as he continued to paddle.
111111.title: Old Salt Floatzel needs a drink

1111111.content:
After some time, Floatzel had finally convinced the hefty Miltank to stick to the edge of the mainlands to avoid the potential storm, for now, he has prevented a repeat of past events. However he still needed to get home himself as he has promised Valerie that he would be home as soon as possible, It was already late in the afternoon and he still had a long trip ahead of him.

Floatzel took to swimming close to the mainland, avoiding swimming to far out to sea, this method took him much longer, but it was the safest route, though as he swam home, the thought did cross his mind, what if he were to ignore Lugia's warning, what if he were to drink the entire ocean and become the biggest Pokemon in existence once more.

It was very tempting, but he couldn't. Not only had he promised Valerie that he would not go overboard with his eating, but Arceus had warned him that should he cause havoc due to his gluttony he would be severely punished.

"I do miss those days" Floatzel said to himself as he paddled along "I would love to be that big again, I miss those galaxy sized meals with Val, heck I even miss devouring and being devoured by Luxray, we escaped each others stomachs so many times..." He added chuckling to himself "I wonder how he's doing, I wonder if he even remembers our past life"

Floatzel's thoughts danced about with past events as fantasies of growing bigger and bigger as he feasted on existence itself, but he also had a family to consider, his children and Val also meant the world to him, he wanted to look after them and spend time with them more than anything, yet this still did not fully quell his temptations. But for now he decided he would fight said temptations and selfish desires for their sake, rather than his own.

It struck evening, before Floatzel finally made his way back home.

While they did live on the main land, they had constructed an undersea passage which connected to their home, the passage itself was large enough to accommodate both Floatzel and Valeries large bodies, however due to Floatzels recent eating splurge, the passage was a tight squeeze, however with some delicate swimming he progressed his way through the passage and finally into his home.

"I'm home" Floatzel called out!

"Oh you're finally back!" Valerie replied as she made her way over to greet him

"Sorry I took so long" Floatzel said, though just as he was about to explain what happened, Valerie interrupted him, placing a paw over his mouth

"No need to explain dear, I already know what happened" See said in soothing and reassuring tone

"Wait... you do?"

"Yes, Lugia telepathically explained to me the whole thing, he warned me about the storm and told me to not go looking for you until everything was all clear" Valerie elaborated "Though he said I wasn't to expect to see you until tomorrow?"

"I kind of ignored his advice to stay put, and just kept to the mainlands instead, to avoid the storm" Floatzel replied sheepishly

"Oh well, you're home now" Valerie replied with a gentle smile.
1111111.title: Home Sweet Home

choices: The bridge door on Floatzel slides open, and out Luxray comes...
Luxray comes in from another different direction.
111111111.content:
(Note: Luxray appears in the next chapter.)

"Whoa, you've been kinda letting yourself go lately." Valerie mused, as her chubby tail propelled herself forward along the water, checking her Floatzel cruise-ship lover out.

"That obvious, huh? I'm kind of surprised I still managed to fit in that little tunnel back there." Floatzel replied.

"Teehee, I *urrrrp* took the liberty of widening it while you were away." Valerie let slip a belch, as she continued to paddle. "Though, it seems, of course, that I'm in turn widening myself as well..." the Vaporeon grabbed one of her many enormous folds of blubber with a paw, feeling a little aroused as she pawed it, a light pink blush showing through her azure face.

"Hahahaha....Thanks a lot then, Val." Floatzel chuckled.

"Ah, it's a pleasure."

"Mail System Online! Floaty, you have -two- new messages."

"Oh, that automated voice, it's back. I wonder where it went." Floatzel said, surprised, as he heard the voice echo through his headset which fitted ever so tightly around his noggin.

"Please press the [main] button to read the first message. Press the [sub] button instead for the second message."

In response, Floatzel tilted his head slightly to the right, depressing the button on the headset against his mountains of chins.

"First message. Text message from Cruise Manager."

To Floaty of the S.S. Inflatable,

Please be informed that multiple reports have been filed against you for your recent actions, and investigations are under way. If they are found to be valid charges, penalties will be imposed.

Also, please remember to report at the port of Snowpoint by 8am tomorrow to resume the previously interrupted trip.

"Oh well, they found out anyways." Floatzel said.

"Guess you can't please them all, Floaty dear?" Valerie said, before making her way slowly up Floatzel's belly, one love handle at a time.

"I was only doing what I thought was right, nothing more. When that storm arrives, they will know."

"Oh-kay then. Guess there's nothing to worry about!" Valerie cooed, as she spread herself out lazily on top of the river otter's massive belly, trying to cover as much of her lover's cream furred stomach as possible with her own body.

"End of first message. Second message will play in three seconds. Press [main] to cancel."

"Let's see what this one is about."

"Second message. Voice message from Miltank of the S.S. Moomil. Message Part 1."

Floatzel heard a loud beep from the headset, before some noise was heard and the headset crackled to life once more.

*bzzt bzzzzt...*

"Hey there Floaty! It's Miltank 'ere! You know...thanks for bringing me all the way back to Slateport. Normally I find it a really tiring thing to swim by myself all the way back to port, much less being able to do it at your size, with someone as heavy as myself bearing on top with such ease. Where on earth do you get that kind of...strength for that?!

Oh, you're a Water Pokemon, I guess, so the ocean's kinda second nature to you. Still though, it amazes me, and those fluffy tails of yours though, make me quite jealous! I wish I had even had a tail a fraction of that caliber, much less two, then I'll be able ta swim almost as fast as you do.

Anyway I think I'm kind of sidetracking here, so I'll just get to the *urrrrp* excuse me, *burrrpp* point...that pile of garbage you gave me earlier, all tons of it? To my surprise I managed to greedily devour all of it shortly after you swam off, and boy was I really, really stuffed~ So I took a short nap soon after to let it digest, and an even bigger surprise awaited me- turns out I was packing on so much fat as I digested, that my belly threatened to climb up the port I was docked at!

(mumbling)Nothing beats a good supper to stuff myself after a long hard day though. Thanks a load, Floaty dear. *BURP*

The crew woke me up in a jolt telling me I should fall back a little into the ocean, and so I did, only to be told the same thing a minute later! Turns out my body is packing on blubber more and more quickly as I grow, and I'm still growing outwards even as I speak...oh, here it comes again! *loud gurgling from Miltank's own belly, followed by the distant sound of fur scraping against pavement*

Murrr, that felt sooo good! Sorry for my rambling. Maybe it could have happened to you before so it's no big deal to you, but it probably is to me. Should I be worried though?

Anyways, talk to you later. I need my beauty sleep! See you around soon...I guess..."

"Message Part 2. Time sent: About two hours later from Part 1"

"Floaty! Miltank of the S.S. Moomil again, although I'm not sure if I'll still retain this name for long. (She sounds flustered and excited at the same time; it is hard to tell.) Sorry to disturb you once more, but maybe I should let you in on this...

They ordered a temporary closure of Slateport...all because of me. Since the last message I sent you I outgrew both the company's and my own expectations, and smothered a good portion of the Slateport's port area while I slept! Now my belly is the only thing I can see for miles ahead of me. In my massive growth spurt the ship structures around me came off like the twigs they are now, so that prevents me from being a proper cruise ship til they get me repaired. Oh well.

Luckily the growth seems to have stopped, and I'm feeling a little hungry. Guess my stomach's painfully empty now after all that huh? The company told me to stay put until they can find a proper course of action, so I'm left on hold, with countless small tingling feelings on my belly area from all directions poking at it I can't quite put my hoove on what they exactly are. Maybe they're just other curious Pokemon, or workers moving away things that it run over...the sensation is quite tintillating indeed.

The turn of events today after meeting you is making my head throb. Can't say for sure what will happen to me, now that I'm large enough to officially become my own island of Miltank...but the prospect of them officially declaring me an island makes me warm and fuzzy inside, and my lips water!

Bye for now. Come visit sometime?"

"End of message. No new messages at present."

"Well, she's definitely staying safely at port." Floatzel sighed.

"Naughty, naughty Floaty!" Valerie teased.

"W-what are you getting at?!"

"She sounded quite...close to you. Who is she really, and why have you hid this from me?" Valerie demanded.

"She's just a coworker, nothing more. It didn't come up in my mind until these messages, honest! I've only just met her today." Floatzel explained.

"Surely you're not going to leave me and our children behind for her, given that she's so much bigger than I am at present (and possibly even you too Floaty?)" Valerie asked, while hugging the river otter's chins tightly.

"No, of course not Valerie! Our love will remain true. Besides, I find Miltank a tad noisy at times..." said Floatzel.
111111111.title: Family's Reunion, and a Minor Dispute

choices: What's a cruise career compared to a once-in-a-lifetime whirlpool?
Floatzel won't do it, as he feels a need to keep true to his word.
1111111111.content:
All of a sudden, the door to the bridge behind Floatzel slid open, and out walked a figure...

"Ah, after nearly eight hours of hard work I finally fixed it all!"

"W-what? Who's there?!" Floatzel and Valerie said in unison.

"Mmhh?" the figure stepped out of the darkness of the unlit bridge, and it was...a Luxray!

"Lux!"

"Luxray!"

"Whoa there, no need to shout my name out like that! Chill it, yo." the Luxray stumbled backwards in shock, dropping a toolbox onto Floatzel's soft fur.

" 'Fixed it all'? What exactly were you fixing?" Floatzel wondered.

"I was taking care of the communications and servers onboard you, silly! Never mind the shoddy electrical engineering on board, but the lack of maintenance is simply unacceptable-"

"Hey, watch it! I think these, say ship structures on me, are a technological marvel!" Floatzel rebuked.

"Pah, whatever you say, we Pokemon are serving humans all the same." Luxray sulked, before walking forward to pick up his toolbox with his mouth.

The Luxray was your standard everyday Luxray, except that he was wearing a leather vest adorned with electrical spare parts of all sorts and sizes, structured to suit his canine-like body. Also a quite obvious pot belly could be seen protruding under his vest, swaying a bit with his gait.

"C-could it...really be you, Lux?" Valerie called out to him.

"Eh? Floaty here I know, I've been working on board him for quite long fixing things here and there. As for you...*squinting* Nope, never quite seen you around before!" Luxray replied.

"Awww...maybe you've just forgotten. You'll remember one day." Valerie cooed.

"Don't think so, I don't have a habit of making friends with someone as corpulent as you, unless of course you're workin' as a cruise shippy like my river otter friend here!" Luxray said, while turning to stare at Floatzel's head.

"Why you little- Ah, I suppose that's true..." Valerie blushed.

"Someone like you should be joining the company and applying to be a cruise ship too! It's a growing industry, literally, no pun intended. You could join your Floatzel lover here as you sail the seas, and never be apart again!" Luxray beamed.

"I've...thought of that before, but I don't think that kind of life's for me. I have our children to take care of. But I'll reconsider your kind offer." Valerie spoke.

"Pff...did everyone just knock off from work without me again?" Luxray shouted, a little peeved finding out that his other co-workers were totally absent.

"Ah, it was my fault. I told everyone to evacuate...well, it's a long story." Floatzel admitted.

"Damn announcement system's broke again, by the time I fix it, too late here I am! Never mind that! Was never really on terms with them 'friends' anyway. Guess I should just fall asleep on board you, Floaty mate, my eyes are virtually burning out now. Hope ye don't mind." Luxray said, going back into the bridge.

"Sure, no problem!" Floatzel said, as he heard the bridge door close behind him.

"That...really was him..." Valerie said.

"Yeah, after so long we finally meet him. But he doesn't remember us." Floatzel agreed.

"I don't believe it. Arceus can't have possibly wiped out his memory...that sounds a bit too cruel..." Valerie sobbed.

"It's all right dear. We'll get it back somehow." said Floatzel.

"Since it's come to this, though, Floaty..."

"Eh?" Floatzel said, puzzled.

"We have two choices now, either we stay put in our home and watch the incoming storm, or we could..." said Valerie quite seductively, her eyes beautifully dimming.

"Erm, that? As much as I'd love to, but I think a dozen children's quite a handful already!" Floatzel said, mistaken.

"Geez, get it together. That's not what I meant, dummy!" Valerie smacked him softly with a paw.

"Oh..."

"Don't you think it's just perfect, too perfect, that Lugia told the both of us? He could have just told you or me alone and that will get the job done." Valerie said.

"Maybe he just wanted to be sure that we would stay home together...without seperating over an argument of any sort..." Floatzel explained.

"We are always destined to be together, my dear little river otter." Valerie said, before kissing Floatzel.

"Yes, we are. Isn't the ocean quite lovely under the moonlight?" Floatzel mused, seeing the moon illuminating the waters before them.

"I'm not sure if you'll think the same way, but I think we can make this night...even better than it is now, for the both of us? Just like what Lugia has implied with his 'warning', maybe?" Valerie slurped, her tongue slipping out for a brief moment to moisturise her lips.

"I think I can see where you're getting at, Val."

"Very good! Storm's coming tonight, Lugia said. Let us make the best of it, I said. If you agree with me, I'll bring the children on board, and we'll head out together into the open sea. Then I'll merge with you afterwards, as I wanna feel how you feel being a cruise liner! Before we end up utterly bursting it inside and out, and devouring it of course."

"But...that'll mean..."

"Yes, putting things short we're going to show the whirlpool and storm that we're ready for it. Both of us together should be enough stomach space to down the entire ocean- not that you or I couldn't do it alone, I just want us to be awake for the seafood feast that follows right after!"
"We'll sail right into the whirlpool and let it suck us in, and opening our maw will let us savour what it was intended to deliver!" Valerie said, excitedly.

"You're willing to risk Arceus' wrath...just to bring back the good old days?!" Floatzel said, shocked.

"It should be apparent by now that we both crave that, no? Yup, that I am. I'm not going to force you though, if you don't wanna risk it. If you say no, we'll just stay put and live the remainder of our lives in normalcy."

"Soo, what do you say?" Valerie tempted, her fat cheeks smooshing heavily against Floatzel's own.
1111111111.title: It is Luxray in the flesh, but not of mind...yet.

choices: Luxray gobbles up Floatzel too and remembers everything.
Luxray doesn't remember, but still wants to grow.
11111111111.content:
"I'm not so sure" Floatzel responded

"So, you're content just the way things are?"

"Well, no... I mean yes, I mean... Honestly Val I'm really not so sure" Floatzel sighed

"If I were to be honest with myself, I want things to be like they were, with you and I feasting on planets, and stars and Galaxies, I miss that rivalry I had with Luxray, heck I even miss it when Lux saw me as a potential snack, even Lugia constantly trying to keep us down was fun."

"But I guess you really are worried about Arceus, Huh?" Valerie cooed

"Well that's half of it" Floatzel replied, with that same tone of concern, he would always carry.

"And the other half?"

"I made you a promise remember? I promised that I would tone down on the eating, and be content with how I am now, and suddenly you want me to go crazy" Floatzel replied "I know it's stupid, but I really feel like I need to keep that promise to you!"

"Hah, I guess my rivalry really still is on with Luxray, even if he doesn't remember it"

"Now you're not making any sense dear" Valerie said, confused, tilting her head to the side slightly

"Back when, I guess all of us were finding our feet for eating, anything and everything, Luxray promised me that he wouldn't ever attempt to devour me, granted, I was sure that at the time he was saying this in desperation so he wouldn't be eaten himself, but as time progressed, and both he and I grew fatter and fatter, He never even attempted to. There were plenty of opportunities where he could of gulped me down, but he didn't, He didn't even look at me with hungry eyes.

Even when Lugia had possesed him and forced him to absorb you, but even then when I guess I dove in after you, I could feel him trying his best not to gobble me up too.

So like Luxray I want to be that dedicated to my word!"

"Then I will make Luxray break his promise, so you can break yours!" Valerie said with a child like grin.

"W-wait, what do you mean?"

"Isn't it obvious? I'm going to make Luxray eat you... not just you but me too!"

"B-but he's tiny, he'd burst trying to even fit a fraction of me inside him... let alone you as well... Now you're the one not making any sense" Floatzel yelped

"He'll be fine, after all he used to eat universes with us, right now, we pale in comparison to his real potential, besides, I want to kill two birds with one stone, I want to see if this experience will spark his memory any, and on top of that... as odd as this is, wouldn't it be nice to meet each other in the place were we first met?" Valerie said as she brushed a fat paw across Floatzels bloated cheek.

Just at that moment, footsteps could be heard on the bridge

"Don't mind me" Luxray called out "I left one of my tools here on the bridge"

"Speak of the devil" Valerie chucked "Oh Lux, can you come down here a moment, I need to ask you something"

"Uh, sure ma'am" Luxray replied politely, as he began making his way down to the ground to meet with Valerie and Floatzel. Despite his rounded stomach, he had much agility in his movements, and in no time at all he was down on ground level.

"Lux, dear, this might sound like an odd question, but... if given the chance would you like to be as big as say Floaty here and myself?"

The pudgy Luxray stared up at the two bloated giants, as Valeries question rung about in his ears, his eyes widened, and his face went red, his eyes darted about trying to find the words

"Of course I do" He wanted to say

"I want to eat and eat and grow bigger and bigger and never stop" He tried to say

While he couldn't say a single word, but his expression said everything, of course he did, every day he dreamed about going off on a gluttonous rampage, devouring everything in sight, completely unaware that in a past life he had done just that

"And if I said I could make that happen right now, would you say yes?"

Luxray was still in shock from the question, but he did manage to nod, dumbly.

Valerie looked at Floatzel, with an excited grin on her face

"Alright, lets do this then" Floatzel said, reluctantly

"Excellent" Valerie cheered "I'll go first, since I can should be more easier for him to gobble up, but when he's big enough, you should be able to join me"

"You're the boss" Floatzel said as he glanced over to Luxray whom had no idea what was going on, his face stuck with that same goofy dumbfounded expression.

Valerie turned herself into mist which at first was clearly visible, the white fog billowed throughout the room, and then it surrounded Luxray, leaving nothing but a silhouette of the lion Pokemon, before slowly fading away, leaving no trace of Valerie in sight.

"W-Where did she go?" Luxray asked a bit perplexed

"You'll find out soon enough buddy" Floatzel grinned

And soon enough Luxray did find out, at first it was very slow, and hardly noticeable, but Luxray could feel it, with each breath he could feel himself getting 'thicker' not only just his stomach, but his entire body.

"What's happening to me?" Luxray groaned, a bit wary of such a sensation.

"What you've wished for" Floatzel replied, still grinning

Luxray's stomach hit the ground with a sudden thump, which in response caused the Luxray to sit upright to investigate. His stomach was expanding, swelling up like a balloon almost.

"I'm getting fatter" Luxray beamed, as his girth continued to increase, not only that, his arms, legs, feet and paws grew thicker and fatter too, so to did his cheeks, and his face in general, he continued to grow larger and larger, due to Valeries influence, his neck formed another chin, and then another. Surprisingly, Luxray's jacket which he had grown partial to, did not rip off or even show signs of shredding, it seemed to grow with him, though it obviously looked a lot smaller on him rather than fitting nicely like it had prior.

Floatzel couldn't help but watch in awe at Valeries handiwork, curiously poking Luxray's big rounded blue stomach, it was soft to touch, much like his own, he looked at the expanding Luxray and observed his expression, Luxray looked like he was having the time of his life, he even sounded like it as Luxray himself couldn't help but let out moans, growls and even purrs of pleasure.

At that moment, all doubt was cleared from his mind, he had decided, after seeing Luxray so pleased with himself for growing to that size, imagine his own pleasure when the ocean itself is in his own stomach, and not just the ocean, but all the Pokemon who dwell in the sea too.

"Alright, I'll make Luxray break his promise, so I can break mine" Floatzel said to himself aloud

As Floatzel came to his conclusion, he was then confronted by a Luxray who was almost as big as he was.

"How you feeling there buddy?" Floatzel asked with an amused expression on his face

Luxray had to take a moment to fully take in what just happened, he was huge, he never thought it possible to be this huge, but it happened.

"I feel amazing" Luxray roared, much like he had done in the past when he had finished a 'big meal'

"I can't believe i'm actually saying this, but... Ready for the second course?" Floatzel asked

"What do you mean?" Luxray asked, still a bit giddy from his experience

"Well me, I'm going to be your second course, strange I know, but it's Val's idea, though we're going to be doing this one a bit differently, you're going to have to swallow me whole, since I cant turn into mist without Val's help" Floatzel explained

"But Floatzel, I promised I wouldn't eat you again" Luxray replied, not realizing the implications or the origins of said promise.

"Wait, you remember now?" Floatzel gasped

"Remember what?" Luxray responded blankly

"Our past life, our endless feasts! of Planets, and the Stars, and even Galaxies!" Floatzel explained

"I haven't a clue what you are talking about, I am pretty sure if we did something like that, I would remember for one, and two neither of us would be on earth, because we'd be too big for it" Luxray laughed

"Then when did you make that promise not to eat me then, when up until now there was no possible way for you to even do so" Floatzel responded, a little bit frustrated

"I..." Luxray paused for a second "I don't know, you're right, there was absolutely no reason for me make such a promise, but... I do remember making it."

"Lux!" Valerie chimed from inside his stomach "Gobble up my dear Floatzel anyway, it might bring back some more memories."

"I said to myself I would never want to be in anyone's stomach ever again, even if I can escape with ease, but I'll do it for you buddy, now open wide, S.S Inflatable is ready to set sail"
11111111111.title: Initial doubts, and a promise.

choices: They reach the location, but find it heavily contested by other fat Pokemon!
Lugia, seeing the chain of events unfold telepathically, goes out to meet them.
111111111111.content:
"W-what?" Luxray said out, feeling quite dazed from the duo's attempts to bring back his memories. "That Vaporeon you call 'Val' just weaseled her way into me, and ended up in my stomach? Maybe?"

"Yep, she just did, but trust me, she'll come to no harm." Floatzel reassured him. "Just open up as wide as you can and swallow me up!" The river otter said confidently, spinning his tails up to speed and cruising forward towards Luxray.

The huge Luxray, despite his newfound size, was still quite shocked watching a ginormous, furry belly growing ridiculously larger as Floatzel surged towards him. "I'm not ready yet! I'll just burst inside out if I try to eat you-" Luxray screamed fearfully at the top of his lungs, his maw wide open, but was soon cut short by Floatzel's belly being shoved forcefully against his jaws.

"Mmmff...gulp gulp gulp." Luxray went, as he responded almost instinctively, making rapid progress in swallowing the cruise-ship river otter. In a few quick swallows Floatzel's belly was halfway out of view, and filled his own painfully stretched maw. Luxray himself could feel the fuzz enter his throat, the combined effect of Floatzel's own propulsion and his swallowing loosen his throat, thus allowing Floatzel's blubber-laden belly to continuously flow down his throat.

"Wow Luxray, you've barely lost your touch." Floatzel said, amazed, reminding himself of the time he and Valerie were fused together in the same body while in space, and in that galactic feast they grew so huge that when a stray black hole was sucking everything else in, it got plugged completely by a single one of their belly rolls. It still continued to suck them in , but only managed to do so partially before it reached their maw, where they countered it with a bottomless cosmic vacuum of their own, devouring the black hole itself completely as well as the prizes it sucked up before.

"What...is this feeling.." Luxray thought, as some random flashbacks of the former 'fatapocalypse' began to play back in his head...something about Lugia, competition with Floaty...what?!

Luxray steeled himself again as he felt the rougher ship structures attached to Floatzel brush past his maw, his own stomach swelling out larger and larger as the river otter's belly completely entered.

"You're doing great, Lux, I can already see Floaty's lovely looking belly!" Valerie cheered, whilst making herself comfortable in the closed confines of Luxray's stomach walls, feeling her own blubbery body make contact with her lover's warm fuzzy flab, as well as some bits of cold metal. "Just a little more and I can see Floaty's chubby little face- oh!" Valerie called out as Floatzel's head entered, with Luxray having eaten him up to his enormous butt by now.

"It's very tight in here, as always. Hope this works out as well as we think." Floatzel commented, hearing his ship structures groan and creak louder as his body pressed against Valerie, as well as Luxray's stomach walls. "Gahh~ Just like when we first met, Floaty dear!" the Vaporeon squealed, as she brought her cheeks close to the river otter's, causing them to smoosh tightly together.

*HHHHGGGGTHONKCLANG!*

"Oof, there goes the cabins below sea level. And the bridge directly behind me!" Floatzel lamented as he felt a slight sting from the ship structures experiencing structural collapse.

Outside Luxray's stomach, Luxray was almost done devouring the cruise-ship river otter, left with only his humongous twin tails to swallow, having stopped spinning by Floatzel himself to make things easier for him. A few good slurps made them disappear into the Luxray's belly like thick noodles, leaving a super sized, fit to burst Luxray floating on the ocean belly up.

"Sweet Arceus, how did I manage to *BRAAAAAAAAAPPPP*" Luxray mumbled, bewildered, before being cut off by a colossal burp escaping his system. "What in the-" Luxray shuddered, before he closed his eyes, focusing on the recollections entering his head, all the memories suppressed by Arceus being suddenly unlocked...

"I think that did the trick, Val!" Floatzel said enthusiastically.

"Told you it'll work. Now let's get those structures off, they're starting to look quite uncomfortable on you!" Valerie said, as she liquefied her own body in contact with Floatzel, diffusing gradually into the river otter. Floatzel could feel himself getting bigger and fatter as Valerie fused with him, the tightly binding though weakening structures snapping off or being crushed under his growing fats as they no longer suited his expanding girth!

As Valerie's body completely diffused into him, his body quickly changed in
form and appearance into that of a Floatzel-Vaporeon hybrid, Floatzel's belly began to shrink a little as blubber realigned to pack more on his hips and butt, his twin tails also lost their fluff and gained in mass, sprouting fins at the end of each tail.

The white neck fin characteristic of a standard Vaporeon also shot forth from between his neck rolls and his own head, followed by dark blue spines adorning their back, beginning from his head and working their way down to his tails, splitting two ways as they followed the direction of the twinned, powerful finned tails.

Basically while his body shape was transforming into that of a Vaporeon's, he still retained some of his own original characteristics, namely his floatation sac, which had just simply turned white and more tough and leathery, with rows of fins fully lining it. Whereas Valerie's body was mostly blue, his body ended up adopting the colour scheme, with his orange fur turning blue as well, although the cream fur on his belly only turned slightly whiter, still giving forth considerable accent to the appearance of their own impressive showcase of a belly.

The last of the cruise structures finally came off as they completed their fusion into a hybrid of themselves, letting the both of them feel more free to spread out once more, despite the heavily confined space they were in. "So, how did it feel?" Floatzel asked. "Actually, there was a lot of me to put in...I was planning to enjoy that feeling slowly, but it got quickly uncomfortable as they stressed against our body, so I sped it up to get them all off!" Valerie complained.

"Given our combined girth, and change in body shape, well, guess it was no match, huh?" Floatzel concluded, using his tails to slowly bring about the ruined structures close to their head. "I don't think I'll be as good at the cruise job as you are, Floaty dear...I've always gotten that feeling that this ship of yours should taste better eaten than worn! Valerie said, while taking a big bite.

"It's all yours then, Valerie dear."

"Maybe you should have some too, Floaty? It's been such a dear to you for so long, surely you feel some attachment?"

"Well, if you say so, although I'm kind of relieved to be finally rid of this." Floatzel sighed lightly.

"Everything's coming back to me now...Floaty! Valerie!" Luxray called out to them.

"Yeah?" they both replied in unison.

"I forgot to tell you, Lugia also gave me that warning when I was still working as that electrician. Before I regained my memories." Luxray admitted. "I just shirked it off, thinking it was a mistake...I'm guessing you're going to pay the storm a visit, right now?"

"YES! That's correct, Lux." Floatzel shouted. "Glad to have you back! Normally we'd swim there, but...since we're in your belly right now..." Floatzel droned.

"You're expecting me to swim out into the open sea with this wide load in my belly?!" Luxray roared, unable to believe his ears. "Don't expect too much, I was never really good in the water." he said sadly, before beginning to paddle, inching across the water towards the open sea.

"Kinda...we're going to need some help though if we are to make it in time. Oh, I know! I think this could work..." valerie spoke, closing their eyes.

"Oh, what's going on?" Floatzel said, feeling a cool sensation on his back near his tails.

Valerie turned their tails to mist, and caused the mist to diffuse through Luxray's own belly. Soon after, Luxray began to feel something growing alongside his little star-tipped tail, it was a plump thick finned tail elongating forth, identical to that of the Floatzel-Vaporeon hybrid's own! As it grew it extended into the water, allowing Luxray to feel a cool, almost alien sensation. Feeling the tail come under his control, he gave it a good stroke, pushing him a good distance.

"Guess I can only lend you one tail for a moment, it's really taxing to maintain one, let alone two." Valerie said, continuing to maintain the misting of their tails.

"Valerie, don't push yourself too hard, I don't wanna lose you again!" Floatzel said, getting concerned.

"It's okay. Luxray's a different type than we are so there's some difficulty in transferring features, thus I'm only letting him 'borrow' it for a short while." Valerie winked.

"Oh, okay then. I suppose you know where to go, Lux?"

"I..think I do." After reassuring himself, he began to swim away from land at a far improved pace.

"Huff, huff..So what's the plan, you two? I am to drink the oceans with you inside me?" Luxray asked.

"Pretty much! We'll just be sitting back and relaxing as you take us there...hope that's okay with you." Valerie said, sheepishly.

"Hopefully I don't lose my way or this tail cramps up, then." Luxray joked.

"I might be real stuffed from taking in you both, but I believe my breaking point's way above that." Luxray said, continuing to swim out towards the ocean.

"That's the spirit Lux! Don't forget if anything happens, give us a holler!" Floatzel shouted, before being silenced by a mouthful of ship material which Valerie was practically shovelling into their maw.
111111111111.title: Towards the ocean it is!

choices: The big four gather, The Storm brews (Part 2)
1111111111112.content:
"Who ever heard of a surfing Luxray" Luxray mused to himself as he continued on course, still trying to get used to not only his massive size, but his modified tail as well.

"You're doing great Lux" Valerie and Floatzel cheered from inside his stomach, as the two continued eating away at the ships materials

"Ah, tis a shame that all my hard work is being chomped away" Luxray said aloud

"What do you mean bud?" Floatzel asked curiously, as Valerie shovelled another chunk of metal down their collective maw.

"I spent so much time maintaining your ship and now its all being guzzled down" Luxray sighed

"Lux you don't have to be such a buzzkill" Valerie huffed

"Sorry, Sorry, I didn't mean to sound depressed about it, infact its all going to a better cause" Luxray said with a grin as he pat his own stomach, as a means of figuratively patting Floatzels gut. "But you know what I mean though."

"Well I guess so" Valerie replied quietly "Anyway Lux, how long until we're at the eye of the storm so to speak?"

"Hmm, if my calculations are right, we should be at our destination in another 20 minutes" Luxray responded

"Well look at you buddy, who'd of thought it, you actually make a pretty good ship yourself" Floatzel teased

"Hmm, what would they of called Lux if he was 'built' as a cruise ship like you dear?" Valerie pondered

"S.S Scrawny" Floatzel shot in.

"Hey!" Luxray growled

"What its true, you were so tiny moments ago" Floatzel responded

"Well right now I'm the biggest Pokemon in the world" Luxray boasted

"Yeah, thanks to Val and I" Floatzel retorted

"And I am very grateful, Thank-You" Luxray replied politely

"That makes me wonder?" Valerie said "Why were you so skinny when we met you, and why were you the only one involved, who didn't remember anything? I mean, when Arceus reset everything we were at least the size of a Wailord, even Lugia, whom instigated all of the destruction in the first place seemed to recall the past events, and Arceus left him with a sizable amount of bulk, from what we saw in our visions, so why were you left out?"

Luxray stopped swimming, he had to pause to think about it, but nothing came to him, he recalled everything so far, even up to the point where Lugia had used Luxray as a means of funneling all of existence into himself, even up to the point where Arceus intervened and prevented Luxray from exploding, but everything past that was a blank.

"I really don't know, but it's not like I did anything worse than you lot right?" Luxray said, as he himself began to question why he was the only one who had forgotten.

"Look bud, don't stress about it too much" Floatzel said "Up until just now you didn't even recall being such a glorious size, you probably didn't think it was even possible, and right now, you're the fattest Luxray ever, if you've still got gaps in your memories, they are bound to come back eventually, and even if they don't, just enjoy what's about to come"

"You're right, the three of us are about to down the entire ocean, and soon the world itself!" Luxray said confidently as he began swimming again, this time picking up the pace to make up for lost time.

"Yeah that's the Luxray I remember!" Floatzel cheered

"Though you are going to cough us back up when we do drain the ocean!" Floatzel added

"Hmm, I'll think about it" Luxray teased

"You better or else im giving you the biggest bellyache in the world" Floatzel huffed

"We'll see, we'll see" Luxray chuckled, as he continued on route.

Luxray scanned the location ahead with his keen vision, they were nearly at their destination, and everything looked clear, until Luxray's eyes caught sight of something big.

"Guy's it looks like we've got trouble up ahead" he shouted

"What do you see?" Floatzel asked

However Luxray did not respond, as suddenly he was greeted by a massive water funnel, that shot up to the clouds above, as within the funnel a huge figure floated upwards from it.

"I-It's... Lugia" Luxray finally blurted out
1111111111112.title: The big four gather, The Storm brews (Part 1)

choices: The Storm hits, and the four down the ocean uncontested
Something approaches possibly to stop them from their goal.
11111111111121.content:
"Crap" Valerie growled "He must want us to turn back"

"Keep calm love" Floatzel replied "It's three against one, and we have a type advantage with Lux with us"

The funnel suddenly dissipated, spraying water everywhere, showering Luxray in seawater, revealing that indeed their suspicions were true, and that Lugia had indeed confronted them. And he was huge, he was easily three times bigger than Luxray, he floated in mid-air like a huge parade blimp, looking down at the swimming Luxray with a Vaporeon's tail.

"Bear with my guys, I don't know if this will affect you any, but here goes!" Luxray growled as his body sparked with thick bolts of neon blue electricity

"Wait, stop, I'm not here to fight, I just want to talk!" Lugia spoke psychically, as he raised one of his hand shaped wings to further gesture Luxray to halt his attack.

"Talk?" Luxray responded perplexed as his electricity lowered to slight flickers.

"Hmm, I see you're all connected, even just slightly, this works well then" Lugia said to himself

"Luxray, open your mouth and eat me, I need to speak with the lot of you on a connected level" He added

"Wait what?" All three chimed in, shocked at what Lugia just asked, before finally Valerie spoke up

"Don't do it Luxray its a trick!" She shouted

"R-Right" Luxray growled as he clenched his teeth shut

"Right now I can easily overpower the lot of you, and claim the ocean for my own, I've drained the ocean countless times in past lives and I can do so again, however, I have a plan, and as much as I don't like to admit it, I need your help to carry it out, all three of you, and potentially others we might be able to recruit along the way" Lugia replied

"Well then spill it" Luxray growled "You don't need to be in my gut to tell us!"

"That's where you are wrong, Luxray" Lugia interrupted "Arceus isn't the only threat to my... no, our feast! And explaining it to you out in the open like this will draw suspicion, I need to do this as covertly as possible"

Floatzel and Valerie pondered to themselves, wondering if Lugia had some other hidden agenda

"Look, I'm not asking you to trust me" Lugia added "But trust that my desire is to grow and that I will do anything to make that happen, even working together with like minded individuals. The four of us, remember how much we managed to do on our own, even when we were all fighting against each other, imagine our potential if we pooled our resources together, the four of us could be gods!"

The three sat there, playing Lugia's words through their heads.

"Guy's, I say we go for it" Luxray said "Nothing ventured nothing gained, besides, none of us thought of a plan to deal with Arceus, as much as I hate to admit it myself, Lugia does seem to be our best bet"

"I suppose you're right" Floatzel sighed

"I'm also going to call Lugia out on his bluff" Luxray said with a smirk on his face as he glanced up at Lugia "He's not as powerful as he's saying he is, otherwise he wouldn't be trying to work with us, so if he does try anything funny, I know you two have got my back... or rather my gut!"

"Yeah, right you are Luxy!" Valerie cheered "If he does anything fishy Floaty and I will kick his butt!"

"The storm will begin to brew in one hour from now" Lugia interrupted "We don't have much prep time, but like I said, Arceus is not the only hurdle we will have to deal with if, so if you are ready, Open up Luxray!"

"Geez, I wish it was this easy in the past life we had" Luxray mused to himself as he opened wide for Lugia to make his way in as well.

Lugia began his descent, head first into Luxray's maw, he pushed himself down whilst lifting Luxray upwards with his psychic powers, Luxray was slightly taken back by how big Lugia was in comparison to himself, his own legs flailed instinctively in response, though even if his stomach felt tight, he knew that it would hold strong, even with Lugia cramming himself in, from the inside, Valerie and Floatzel, decided to help speed up the process by grabbing Lugia's wings and pulling him inwards, which he accepted without any hesitation, the whole situation, amused Lugia as he couldn't help but chuckle as he inched further and further into Luxray's stomach.

"Wha- o- -uny?" Luxray asked, his speech was muffled by Lugia's body, whom was now half way inside.

"Sorry" Lugia spoke, still chuckling a little "I never once thought I'd ever do this willingly"

"Hah, Join the club" Floatzel responded as he gave Lugia one final tug before the rest of him slid into Luxray in a sudden heap.

Luxray fell back into the water, waves crashing about Luxray's enormous body as the rest of Lugia fell into his stomach with a ripe plop. Luxray couldn't help but also let out a monstrous belch in response. The lardy lion Pokemon sat there floating in the ocean, impressed with his now ever bigger girth.

"Now, Lugia" Floatzel said staring at Lugia face to face, their stomachs pressed tightly against each other "This plan of yours!"

"Of course" Lugia responded "But first, we all need to be properly psychically linked."

Lugia's eyes glowed a deep bright blue, and suddenly they no longer found themselves surrounded by the linings of Luxray's stomach but in a giant pantheon, surrounded by countless galaxies. Valerie, Lugia, Floatzel and Luxray, all sat face to face with each other on thrones big enough to cater to their massive bodies, the four looked as they did in their past lives, bigger than universes themselves. The three inspected their bodies, pleased with how big they looked, even Lugia himself looked rather content with his appearance.

"What is this place?" Luxray said breaking the silence "And why aren't you lot in my stomach any more?"

"This place is my psyche manifested into a physical plane" Lugia replied

"Uh, In english?" Floatzel chimed in

"Simply put, this is kind of like a shared dream" Lugia explained "In the real world, we are indeed all still inside Luxray"

"Guess you really do dream big" Luxray teased

"Never mind that for now" Valerie interrupted "So what do you want from us?"

"Of course!" Lugia replied "I want the same thing you want, to just eat and expand, devouring everything in my path, be it this earth, other planets, the stars, galaxies, and universes, I want them all, I want to gobble it all up, and I don't ever want to have to stop."

"Well you aren't wrong there, that's certainly what I want now" Luxray said

"As do we!" Valerie responded

"My plan, is for us to become so powerful that we can defeat Arceus and create that reality where we can spend all of eternity stuffing ourselves silly" Lugia said

"Though to be absolutely honest with you, for the longest time, I only had this planned only for myself, but after failing against Arceus, time, and time again, I realized that I'm going to have to swallow my pride and share my glory, and what a better lot, to share it with than those who've become as big as I have in the past."

"If this is what you wanted all along, why warn us to stay away from the storm?" Floatzel asked

"At the time, I myself was trying to fight my urges, like you, but when, all three of you made the resolve to go ahead regardless, all self control I had myself broke and I wanted my cut of the cake" Lugia explained

"Old habits die hard deary" Valerie replied with an amused sigh.

"Though, the other issue is, there is now a lot more competition" Lugia added

"What do you mean?" Luxray asked

"Well you lot remember in the past life when it was just the other Legendary Pokemon, trying to prevent me from succeeding, and you guys"

"Yeah?" Luxray replied

"Now there are hundreds, if not thousands of Pokemon whom are out there wanting to claim the title of the biggest Pokemon, and will stop at nothing to see it through. To make matters worse, even the humans are finding ways to transform themselves into Pokemon just so they can devour everything, I regret to say it, but one human has gone so far as to obtain my DNA just to turn themselves into a clone of me, and not just me, but the other legendary Pokemon as well.

The good news is, right now, everything is at a standstill, but once the storm hits, and we drain the ocean, all hell is going to break loose, that is the first hurdle, and I think we should focus dealing with rival Pokemon before we deal with Arceus"

"We should have the advantage once we have drained the ocean though, right?" Floatzel asked

"Absolutely!" Lugia replied "We just need to ensure we keep our advantage of size, but for now, we play the waiting game!"

And with those final words, the group woke up from their dream world, with Luxray sitting in the middle of the ocean with his hugely distended stomach, whilst everyone else was crammed inside his belly.

"Luxray" Lugia called out from inside "Keep an eye out for any activity, let us know the moment you see anything unusual"

"Understood" Luxray said as his eyes glowed a bright red as he scanned the ocean around him.
11111111111121.title: The big four gather, The Storm brews (Part 2)

111111111111212.content:
-Two hours ago-
"The coast of Slateport, a coastal city in Hoenn, appears to have been overrun by a most unusual sight today - initial reports and footage point to that of an unexpected growth spurt by an already colossally obese Miltank docked at a port belonging to the leading cruise company of the world; which is responsible for one of the most successful yet hugely controversial 'Pokemon Cruises' business venture.

The Miltank, coined the S.S. Moomil by the cruise company, had just returned from its test voyage due to an emergency, and was even delivered personally to port by the S.S. Inflatable, a similarly obese and much larger Floatzel who has been serving in place of the former S.S. Behemoth, which was put out of commission by the same Floatzel a few months ago. The S.S Inflatable then sailed off to an unknown location.

The cruise company has declined to comment on this matter, saying that investigations are underway, and they have yet to come to a conclusion. We will report again if the situation updates.

In the meantime rescue teams have been scrambled to save those affected by the disaster, and those who are near the affected area can either assist with the relief efforts, or relocate immediately to another location for their own safety.

Please be careful, everyone. This is the Pokemon News Channel, bringing you the night news!"


June was in her own home, alone watching the news on her television whilst laying down lazily on a sofa. "Ah, Miltank, I did the right thing sending you to that cruise company." she mused, whilst reaching for another bag of chocolate bonbons she had left on the table in front of her, amongst empty bags of various other snacks she had guzzled throughout the day at home.

"*munch munch...* Mm. These are simply delicious, I must remember to buy more the next time I go out shopping again." June swallowed a mouthful of chocolate confection, licking her lips clean of chocolate as she continued to watch the next TV programme in line.

The sudden influx of money from letting the company have her Miltank made her a lot more lazy than before, though it wasn't the entire cut of the original offer it was enough to stop her from needing to attend the daily commute everyday, which she hated. Hence she started to live more and more like a couch potato, rarely ever going out unless to buy necessities like food and drink.

Never having so much money to hold on to in a long time made June go wild on her spending, buying lots of new clothes and treating herself to lavish feasts. It was a shame though, she felt, that her body soon outgrew the fancy new clothing she purchased, as her weight quickly sped past 65 kilograms, quite heavy for her height, and the plump trainer would only grow fatter...and wider...

As well as her own appetite...

*RIIIIP* * Snap* *Ping!*

Her skirt which was already bursting at their seams tore open with a loud rip, and the night shirt she was wearing immediately lost another button, revealing her own chubby belly as well as her few love handles behind it.
"Stupid June, told you it was high time to get new clothes!" the chubby June scolded herself, as she struggled to close the shirt that was formally holding her tummy, but to no avail. Feeling somewhat defeated she scoffed another bonbon into her mouth, chewing it with delight as she felt the chocolatey sweetness brush her tastebuds, before swallowing. She reached for yet another, only for her hand to be met with an empty bag. She tossed the empty bag into the pile in disappointment.

"Oh well. It was about time I went out for dinner anyway." she switched off the television, and stared out into the nearby window, the moon shining brightly in the clear sky. "Funny how I barely ate snacks before and now I'm still hungry enough to eat dinner after them! It's crazy." June complained, as she took off her shirt and changed into her sweater, which she virtually squeezed into in lieu of her growing chest and waist lines.

The trainer hooked the plaid skirt around her waist, feeling it barely fit her as it dug in tightly into her own flabby flesh. "Geez this is tight! But there's nothing better to wear...for now." June said to herself, before slipping into her boots, walking out of her door and locking it behind her.

A chilling breeze blew past her, rustling her hair as she made her way to the main street, the sound of snow crushing beneath her feet.
"So, I'ma get dinner first, then some fitting clothes..." she started to counted on her own fingers as she walked.
"And more snacks..."

It was then she stumbled upon a buffet restaurant, on its grand opening. She had been monitoring it for quite a while now, and it was about high time it opened.
So why not? She thought, licking her lips as the appetising smell of grilled meat wafted past her nostrils.

"Time to demolish them on their first day," she thought as she gleefully stepped into the restaurant, welcoming the buffet spread and the crowd before her.


"So much for *BURP* demolishing them..." June let out a belch, as she stumbled out of the restaurant, profusely rubbing her fat and swollen stomach after having ate her fill. The trainer walked her way to the nearby department store, her belly still showing from having her sweater retreating upwards.

Paying and changing into a bigger set of clothes, she placed her old set of duds into the bag they provided her during her shopping trip. "Won't be needing them anymore, though I'll just keep them as a memento, or if someone wants them." June thought as she descended the escalators into the food section.

"Chips, biscuits, chocolate bonbons, more chocolate bonbons...stop it June, that's quite enough." she loaded her shopping basket to the brim and headed for the cashier.

June could not help but notice the stares and passing comments she got as she made her way back home with lots of bags in tow filled with nothing more than her precious goodies. "Pff, as if they've never seen fat girls before, the neighbour living next door's definitely even wider than I am! They're lucky I'm not in a bad mood, unless I'll...never mind." she huffed, an breathing out an opaque mist in the cold air.

In the darkness of the desolate street, a single lone car drove towards her. The black car stopped in front of her, and out stepped two well built men, each in a business suit.
"G-good evening...who are you?" she blurted out, somehow knowing they had business to do with her. "Miss June, correct? You must come with us immediately!" one of the men spoke.

"Eh eh? What do you mean?" she took a step back in retreat, while the men took two towards her.

"Come with us peacefully into the vehicle and you will not be harmed. We'll explain things along the way." one of the men assured her, while approaching the trainer.

"Don't you dare touch me." she affirmed, while putting her arms up in a defensive position. June was clearly scared with the suddenness and mystery in this situation.

"We haven't much time! Look, the President is expecting you." the man asked again, almost about to reach for the taser in his pocket.
111111111111212.title: In the interests of science... (Part 1)

1111111111112121.content:
"President?! C-could it be...Fine. I'll come with you." June said, as she walked slowly over to the open door of the car, with the man closely following her, and the other one getting back into the driver's seat. She eased herself into the plush leather seat, and buckled the safety belt as the man closed the door with a solid bang. He then opened the door on the other side of the car, sitting directly on June's right.

"Let's go!" On the man's word, the driver put his foot to the pedal, and they drove off. "Right, Miss June, I am sure you are familiar with the Pokemon Cruise program that has been running for a good while now-"

"Oh yes! And my dear Miltank's in it. How is she doing?" June perked up. "About her...Let's just say she's been taken off the program, perhaps permanently, until we can find a solution. I'm sure you've seen what's on the news..." the man shook his head.
"That bad, huh...I'm sorry to hear that." June said, a little dejected.

"The truth is, we have been working on a side project alongside this one, and you being a close partner of the President, he has personally invited you to be a part of it." the man explained. "Normally it was kept under wraps, but there were...complications, and we are desperately seeking contacts to assist us."

"A-assist you? What can I do anyway? I'm just a mere trainer. Maybe you've got the wrong person for the job, mister, shouldn't you be seeking out researchers or something?" June sighed.

"Those we have enough of...suitable test subjects, not so much..."
June gulped hard at 'test subjects', shuddering at the thought. What if they open her up or something, inject her with uncertified chemicals, or worse? She reached for a granola bar in one of her shopping bags, opening it and taking a big bite of it to calm her nerves.

"We are almost there. The President will discuss the terms with you." The man said, before they drove into an underground car park.

After the car was parked, June was led into an elevator by the same two men, and together the descended. How many levels deep down they went, she did not really know, but she could feel her ears popping a couple of times, giving her slight discomfort. One minutes later the lift door sprung open, and the two men exited the elevator in unison, with June following behind them, with her shopping bags still in hand.

To June the place looked like one giant laboratory, the kind that one would normally see in that of science fiction settings. Things like glass windows, solid automated sliding doors were a dime a dozen here, as well as the indiscernable chatter of scientists discussing matters, and the constant whirr of machinery.

"Hello there, young visitor, you must be Miss June." The receptionist said, sweetly.

"Yes, I am."

"Finally someone with a little respect around here..." June mumbled to herself.
